title: Quo Vadis (horse)
text:
Quo Vadis (born 1952) was an outstanding <a href="Quarter%20horse">Quarter Horse</a> show <a href="mare">mare</a> as well as being an outstanding <a href="broodmare">broodmare</a> in the early days of the <a href="American%20Quarter%20Horse%20Association">American Quarter Horse Association</a> (or AQHA).
Life.
Quo Vadis was foaled 1952 and bred by Ross Roberts of <a href="San%20Jon%2C%20New%20Mexico">San Jon, New Mexico</a>. She was a <a href="Black%20%28horse%29">black</a> mare, owned at the time of registration by Marianne Randals of <a href="Snyder%2C%20Texas">Snyder, Texas</a>. Both her sire and her dam's sire were products of the <a href="King%20Ranch">King Ranch</a> <a href="linebreeding">linebreeding</a> program, so Quo Vadis was descended from <a href="Old%20Sorrel%20%28horse%29">Old Sorrel</a> twice. She also traced five times to <a href="Peter%20McCue%20%28horse%29">Peter McCue</a> as well as once to <a href="Traveler%20%28horse%29">Traveler</a>.
Show career.
In Quo Vadis' show career, she earned an AQHA Championship as well as a Performance Register of Merit. She earned a total of forty open <a href="Halter%20%28horse%20show%29">halter</a> points with the AQHA, and twenty-nine open performance points. She earned points in <a href="Cutting%20%28sport%29">cutting</a>, <a href="working%20cow%20horse">working cow horse</a>, <a href="reining">reining</a>, and western riding. She also earned $208.40 in <a href="National%20Cutting%20Horse%20Association">National Cutting Horse Association</a> (or NCHA) cutting competition.
Broodmare record.
After Quo Vadis' show career, she retired to become a broodmare. She had twelve <a href="foal">foal</a>s in total. Eleven of them earned AQHA points in <a href="Halter%20%28horse%20show%29">halter</a>. Four of them became AQHA Champions – Mr. Perfection, Poco Becky, Bonita Dondi, and Kaliman. Three foals earned a Superior Halter Horse award – Madonna Dell, Mr. Perfection, and Kaliman. She also foaled Majestic Dell, a stallion who earned forty-nine halter points, just one shy of his Superior Halter Horse.
Honors.
Quo Vadis was inducted into the <a href="American%20Quarter%20Horse%20Hall%20of%20Fame">AQHA Hall of Fame</a> in 2002.
